original_title: EDOTCO Group CEO meeting with President reaffirms role as country’s preferred telco infrastructure partner
original_body_lines: EDOTCO Services Lanka Ltd. (“EDOTCO Sri Lanka”) proudly welcomed its Group CEO Adlan Tajudin, to Colombo during a recent visit, which included a courtesy meeting with President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

The discussions focused on recent developments in the telecommunications infrastructure sector within the Asian markets and the potential of an inclusive digital economy enabled by equitable digital connectivity for Sri Lanka’s economic growth.

Adlan Tajudin’s visit also involved productive meetings with CEOs of key telecom operators, state agencies, and the Malaysian High Commissioner, further strengthening bilateral ties and exploring potential collaboration opportunities. These engagements solidify EDOTCO’s commitment to fostering connectivity, supporting economic growth, and driving innovation in the telecommunications industry, positioning the company as the preferred telco infrastructure partner in the country.

Addressing a distinguished gathering of executives from the telecommunications industry, Tajudin emphasised the invaluable contribution of Sri Lankan talent to the organisation and recognised the pivotal role played by EDOTCO Sri Lanka in advancing the company’s mission. He expressed his confidence in Sri Lanka’s potential for an economic rebound and stressed the importance of robust infrastructure to support the country’s digital economic growth. Tajudin urged all stakeholders in the telecommunications ecosystem to seize the current window of opportunity.

“We are certain that Sri Lanka stands poised towards economic rebound, and with proper infrastructure in place to assist the digital economic growth, this goal could be easily attained. All stakeholders in the telecommunications ecosystem are responsible for making the most out of this window of opportunity,” said Tajudin.

He added, “Since 2018, EDOTCO Services Lanka has been at the forefront of the country’s telco infrastructure landscape. We are committed to providing the latest telecommunication infrastructure facilities on the island through our extensive multi-purpose streetlamp pole network. Our culture of innovation drives us to serve our customers, connect the underserved, and bridge the digital divide in Sri Lanka.”

Accompanying the Group CEO were esteemed senior leaders from the Kuala Lumpur Head Office, including EDOTCO Services Lanka Director of Strategy and Acting Country Manager Gayan Koralage, Group Chief People Officer Ramon Chelva, Director of Governance, Risk and Compliance Azzahraa Annuar, and Group Head of Corporate Communications and Branding Noreen Sabrina Mohd. Noor. This visit marked a significant milestone for the company, demonstrating its dedication to building strong partnerships and advancing the telecommunications landscape in Sri Lanka.
To learn more about EDOTCO Group and its next-generation services, visit the website at www.edotcogroup.com.
